intro: Thrincia maroccana subsp. ribatejana, commonly known as the Moroccan thrincia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, succulent-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is well adapted to hot, dry climates. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, appearing in clusters, and it is often found in scrubland and semi-desert environments. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and locally endemic species.
